","params":{"payer":"The address of the payer.","serviceID":"The identifier of the service.","token":"The address of the ERC20 token."},"returns":{"amount":"The amount of ERC20 tokens deposited."}},"getERC20FeesFor(address,uint256)":{"details":"Retrieves the amount of ERC20 fees accumulated for a given token and service ID.","params":{"serviceID":"The identifier of the service.","token":"The address of the ERC20 token."},"returns":{"amount":"The amount of ERC20 tokens accumulated as fees."}},"getERC20RefundsFor(address,address,uint256)":{"details":"Retrieves the amount of ERC20 refunds authorized for a given token, refundee, and service ID.  This function is used to query the amount of ERC20 tokens authorized for refund to a refundee for a specific service. ","params":{"refundee":"The address of the refundee.","serviceID":"The identifier of the service.","token":"The address of the ERC20 token."},"returns":{"amount":"The amount of ERC20 tokens authorized for refund."}},"initialize()":{"details":"Initializes the contract."},"owner()":{"details":"Returns the address of the current owner."},"proxiableUUID()":{"details":"Implementation of the ERC1822 {proxiableUUID} function. This returns the storage slot used by the implementation. It is used to validate the implementation's compatibility when performing an upgrade. IMPORTANT: A proxy pointing at a proxiable contract should not be considered proxiable itself, because this risks bricking a proxy that upgrades to it, by delegating to itself until out of gas. Thus it is critical that this function revert if invoked through a proxy. This is guaranteed by the `notDelegated` modifier."},"record(uint256)":{"details":"Returns the fulfillment record for a given id.","params":{"id":"the id of the record"}},"recordsOf(address)":{"details":"Returns the fulfillment records for a given payer.","params":{"payer":"the address of the payer"}},"registerFulfillment(uint256,(uint256,string,string,uint8))":{"details":"The fulfiller registers a fulfillment. We need to verify the amount of the fulfillment is actually available to release. Then we can enrich the result with an auto-incremental unique ID. and the timestamp when the record get inserted. If the fulfillment has failed: - a refund will be authorized for a later withdrawal. If these verifications pass: - add the amount fulfilled to the release pool. - substract the amount from the payer's deposits. - update the FulFillmentRecord to the blockchain.","params":{"fulfillment":"the fulfillment result attached to it."}},"renounceOwnership()":{"details":"Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby disabling any functionality that is only available to the owner."},"setFulfillableRegistry(address)":{"details":"Sets the fulfillable registry address.","params":{"fulfillableRegistry_":"The address of the fulfillable registry."}},"setManager(address)":{"details":"Sets the protocol manager address.","params":{"manager_":"The address of the protocol manager."}},"setRouter(address)":{"details":"Sets the protocol router address.","params":{"router_":"The address of the protocol router."}},"transferOwnership(address)":{"details":"Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner."},"upgradeToAndCall(address,bytes)":{"custom:oz-upgrades-unsafe-allow-reachable":"delegatecall","details":"Upgrade the implementation of the proxy to `newImplementation`, and subsequently execute the function call encoded in `data`. Only the manager can withdraw the accumulated fees.","params":{"serviceId":"The service identifier","token":"The token address"}},"withdrawERC20Refund(uint256,address,address)":{"details":"Refund accumulated balance for a refundee, forwarding all gas to the recipient. 6":"0x32ba59b4b7299237c8ba56319110989d7978a039faf754793064e967e5894418","license":"MIT","urls":["bzz-raw://1ae50c8b562427df610cc4540c9bf104acca7ef8e2dcae567ae7e52272281e9c","dweb:/ipfs/QmTHiadFCSJUPpRjNegc5SahmeU8bAoY8i9Aq6tVscbcKR"]},"lib/openzeppelin-contracts/contracts/utils/math/Math.sol":{"keccak256":"0x005ec64c6313f0555d59e278f9a7a5ab2db5bdc72a027f255a37c327af1ec02d","license":"MIT","urls":["bzz-raw://4ece9f0b9c8daca08c76b6b5405a6446b6f73b3a15fab7ff56e296cbd4a2c875","dweb:/ipfs/QmQyRpyPRL5SQuAgj6SHmbir3foX65FJjbVTTQrA2EFg6L"]}},"version":1}

beneficiaryWithdraw(uint256,address).details: Withdraws the beneficiary's available balance to release (fulfilled with success). Only the fulfiller of the service can withdraw the releaseable pool.

depositERC20(uint256,(address,uint256,st.details: Stores the sent amount as credit to be claimed.

params.fulfillmentRequest: The fulfillment record to be stored.

getERC20DepositsFor(address,address,uint.details: Retrieves the amount of ERC20 deposits for a given token, payer, and service ID.  This function is used to query the amount of ERC20 tokens deposited by a payer for a specific service.

params.token: The address of the ERC20 token.

returns.amount: The amount of ERC20 tokens deposited.

getERC20FeesFor(address,uint256).details: Retrieves the amount of ERC20 fees accumulated for a given token and service ID.

params.token: The address of the ERC20 token.

returns.amount: The amount of ERC20 tokens accumulated as fees.

getERC20RefundsFor(address,address,uint2.details: Retrieves the amount of ERC20 refunds authorized for a given token, refundee, and service ID.  This function is used to query the amount of ERC20 tokens authorized for refund to a refundee for a specific service.

params.token: The address of the ERC20 token.

returns.amount: The amount of ERC20 tokens authorized for refund.

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

proxiableUUID().details: Implementation of the ERC1822 {proxiableUUID} function. This returns the storage slot used by the implementation. It is used to validate the implementation's compatibility when performing an upgrade. IMPORTANT: A proxy pointing at a proxiable contract should not be considered proxiable itself, because this risks bricking a proxy that upgrades to it, by delegating to itself until out of gas. Thus it is critical that this function revert if invoked through a proxy. This is guaranteed by the `notDelegated` modifier.

record(uint256).details: Returns the fulfillment record for a given id.

recordsOf(address).details: Returns the fulfillment records for a given payer.

registerFulfillment(uint256,(uint256,str.details: The fulfiller registers a fulfillment. We need to verify the amount of the fulfillment is actually available to release. Then we can enrich the result with an auto-incremental unique ID. and the timestamp when the record get inserted. If the fulfillment has failed: - a refund will be authorized for a later withdrawal. If these verifications pass: - add the amount fulfilled to the release pool. - substract the amount from the payer's deposits. - update the FulFillmentRecord to the blockchain.

params.fulfillment: the fulfillment result attached to it.

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby disabling any functionality that is only available to the owner.

params.fulfillableRegistry_: The address of the fulfillable registry.

params.manager_: The address of the protocol manager.

params.router_: The address of the protocol router.

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

upgradeToAndCall(address,bytes).details: Upgrade the implementation of the proxy to `newImplementation`, and subsequently execute the function call encoded in `data`. Calls {_authorizeUpgrade}. Emits an {Upgraded} event.

withdrawAccumulatedFees(uint256,address).details: Withdraws the beneficiary's available balance to release (fulfilled with success). Only the manager can withdraw the accumulated fees.

withdrawERC20Refund(uint256,address,addr.details: Refund accumulated balance for a refundee, forwarding all gas to the recipient. WARNING: Forwarding all gas opens the door to reentrancy vulnerabilities. Make sure you trust the recipient, or are either following the checks-effects-interactions pattern or using {ReentrancyGuard}.

params.refundee: The address whose funds will be withdrawn and transferred to.
params.token: The address of the ERC20 token.
